sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of travel outcome occurring on a trip
message_1: A student is planning to travel from New York to Los Angeles. The probability that their flight will be on-time is 0.85. Given that their flight is on-time, the probability of their luggage arriving at the same time is 0.95. What is the probability that the student's flight will be on-time and their luggage will arrive at the same time?
message_2:
To find the probability that both the student's flight will be on-time and their luggage will arrive at the same time, we can multiply the probabilities of these two events occurring together.

Probability of flight being on-time = 0.85
Probability of luggage arriving at the same time given the flight is on-time = 0.95

Probability of both events occurring together = 0.85 * 0.95 = 0.8075

So, the probability that the student's flight will be on-time and their luggage will arrive at the same time is 0.8075 or 80.75%.
